WHAMMY!

Jun 16, 2024

Onomatopeia

Boom! Bang! Pop! Whammy!

Onomatopoeia is a word or group of words that, when spoken aloud, imitates the sound it produces. Roy Lichtenstein was an artist who mastered panting with his medium of pointillism creating artwork that used thousands of dots and lines to create large paintings of onomatopeas "boom", "whammy"and my all time favorite"pop!" Below is one of Roy's famous paintings showing the onomatopoeia word, "CRACK" . . . .

Rhetoric

To tell a tale that tantalizes the throngs, try alliteration, whichi refers to using the same sound, usually a consonant, at the beginning of words near each other in a sentence.
